intro: Smyrnium laterale, commonly known as the greater cowplant, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Smyrnium laterale is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. It is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory effects.
